chargeHist.descr: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Barek J Wentworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat to Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**121 days credit, if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF500, 21CF711

miscConds.notes: Court orders Restitution is to be determined within 60 days.

No contact with M.C. (co-defendant). 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No entry into any bars, taverns, or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Not to consume or possess any alcohol. 
Not to consume, possess, or use any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
Not to possess any weapons.

Psychological assessment and follow through with any recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Court finds the Defendant is eligible for Huber or Electronic Monitoring at the discretion of the jail. 
Court orders 10 days may be served by 80 hours of Community Service. (Defendant chooses Community Service)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barek J Wentworth

records.addlTxt: Ck# 44354 mailed to DOC; cash bond to be applied to Court Costs & Fines collected by DOC

(Cases 22CF1086, 21CF500, 21CF711, 22CF324 are called at 3:43 PM) Defendant Barek J Wentworth in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. State indicates that case 22CF1086 should be sent back into intake. Off the record- Counsel schedules 22CF1086 for October 4, 2022 at 9:30 AM returns in intake. 
Defense has received and reviewed the Presentence Investigation- notes corrections for the record. State makes argument for sentence recommendation. Defense makes argument for sentence recommendation. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation concurrent to each other with the following conditions: 10 days jail or 80 hours of community service in 22CF324 (Defendant chooses Community Service), Court finds the Defendant is eligible for Huber or Electronic Monitoring at the discretion of the jail; Restitution to be determined within 60 days; No contact with M.C. (co-defendant); No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; No entry into any bars, taverns, or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol; Not to consume or possess any alcohol; Not to consume, possess, or use any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia; Not to possess any weapons; AODA and follow through with recommendations; Psychological assessment and follow through with any recommendations; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 
Court orders in 22CF324- 121 days credit, if revoked; in 21CF711- 23 days credit, if revoked; in 21CF500- 2 days credit, if revoked.
Sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

9:02 AM Cases called: 22CF324, 22CF964, 21CF500 & 21CF711. Defendant Barek J Wentworth in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Barek J Wentworth.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

State moves to Dismiss with Prejudice, 22CF964 and requests that the seized contraband is destroyed. Court orders 22CF964 is dismissed with prejudice and seized contraband is ordered destroyed. 

Defendant has not reviewed the Presentence Investigation with his attorney. Sentencing hearing: 09/29/22 at 3:45pm for 45 min in person.
No further conditions ordered by the Court.
Sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:40 PM Cases called: 20CM569, 20CM1134, 21CF500, 21CF629, 21CF711, 21CF712, 21CF871, 21CF908, 21CF1031, 21CM276 & 22CF324. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant Barek J Wentworth in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Barek J Wentworth. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared via Zoom video. The parties have an agreement.

Defendant enters a no contest plea to:
22CF324 Count 1: Threat to Law Enforcement Officer
21CF908 Count 7: Carry Concealed Weapon
21CF500 Count 1: Forgery-Uttering
21CF711 Count 1: Attempt Possession of Narcotic Drugs

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders on:
21CF908: court costs DNA sample and surcharge. 
22CF324, 21CF500 & 21CF711: Presentence Investigation. State will be bound to the recommendation. Defense will be free to argue. Sentencing Hearing: 09/13/22 at 9am for 30 min, in person. Report due to Court by 08/26/22.

Parties stipulate as part of the agreement, that the cash bond is converted to a $3000 signature bond with the same conditions. 

Anything else, including citations, are ordered dismissed and read in.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)

10:30 AM cases 21CF500, 21CF711, 21CF712, 21CF629, 21CM276, 20CM1134, 22CF324, 20CM569, 21CF1031, 21CF908, 21CF871 called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Barek J Wentworth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Barek J Wentworth. Victim/Witness statute complied with in all files. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In all felony files: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
A status conference is scheduled for 7/11/22 at 3:30 PM (30 min).
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF500, 21CF629, 21CF711, 21CF712, 21CF871, 21CF908, 21CF1031, 22CF324, 20CM569, 21CM276, 20CM1134 are called at 2:47 PM) Defendant Barek J Wentworth in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Barek J Wentworth.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 21CF712, 21CF871, 21CF908, 21CF1031. Defendant also waives right to preliminary hearing to all Felony Bail Jumping charges in 21CF711, 21CF629, 22CF324, 21CF500. 
21CF711- State calls Officer Marcus Walden, Eau Claire Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Officer Walden by Defense. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case. 
21CF629- State calls Officer Jacob Roberts, Eau Claire Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Officer Roberts by Defense. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case. 
22CF324- State calls Officer Noah Young, Eau Claire Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Officer Young by Defense. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case. 
21CF500- State calls Detective Oliva Erl, Eau Claire Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Detective Erl by Defense.  Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case. 
All cases (21CF500, 21CF629, 21CF711, 21CF712, 21CF871, 21CF908, 21CF1031, 22CF324, 20CM569, 21CM276, 20CM1134) are to be scheduled for an arraignment with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.

records.addlTxt:
(11:20 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Barek J Wentworth appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Katherine Cook for Barek J Wentworth appeared by video.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
State requests $5,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Cook requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $3,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
